column1: 2 ^ The mercies of the Lord I will sing for ever~; I will show forth thy truth with my mouth to generation and generation
3 ^ for thou hast said
column2: "Mercy shall be built up for ever in the heavens." Thy truth shall be prepared in them.

column1: 4 ^ I have made a covenant with my elect~; I have sworn to David my servant
5 ^ 'Thy seed will I settle for ever
column2: and I will build up thy throne unto generation and generation.'"

column1: 6 ^ The heavens shall confess thy wonders
column2: O Lord
column3: and thy truth in the church of the saints

column1: 7 ^ for who in the clouds can be compared to the Lord~; who among the sons of God shall be like to God~?
8 ^ God
column2: who is glorified in the assembly of the saints
column3: great and terrible above all them that are about him.

column1: 9 ^ O Lord God of hosts
column2: who is like to thee~? Thou art mighty
column4: and thy truth is round about thee.

column1: 10 ^ Thou rulest the power of the sea~; thou also appeasest the motion of the waves.
11 ^ Thou hast humbled the proud one
column2: as one that is slain~; with the arm of thy strength thou hast scattered thy enemies.

column1: 12 ^ Thine are the heavens
column2: and thine is the earth~; the world and the fulness thereof thou hast founded.

column1: 13 ^ The north and the sea thou hast created~; Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
14 ^ Thy arm is with might~; let thy hand be strengthened
column2: and thy right hand exalted.

column1: 15 ^ Justice and judgment are the preparation of thy throne~; mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
16 ^ Blessed is the people that knoweth jubilation~; O Lord
column2: they shall walk in the light of thy countenance

column1: 17 ^ and in thy name they shall rejoice all the day
column2: and in thy justice they shall be exalted

column1: 18 ^ for thou art the glory of their strength
column2: and in thy good pleasure shall our horn be exalted

column1: 19 ^ for our protection is of the Lord
column2: and of our king the holy one of Israel.

column1: 20 ^ Then thou spokest in a vision to thy saints
column2: and saidst
column3: "I have laid help upon one that is mighty
column4: and have exalted one chosen out of my people."

column1: 21 ^ I have found David my servant~; with my holy oil I have anointed him.
22 ^ For my hand shall help him
column2: and my arm shall strengthen him.

column1: 23 ^ The enemy shall have no advantage over him
column2: nor the son of iniquity have power to hurt him.

column1: 24 ^ And I will cut down his enemies before his face
column2: and them that hate him I will put to flight.

column1: 25 ^ And my truth and my mercy shall be with him
column2: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

column1: 26 ^ And I will set his hand in the sea
column2: and his right hand in the rivers.

column1: 27 ^ He shall cry out to me
column2: "Thou art my father
column4: and the support of my salvation."

column1: 28 ^ And I will make him my firstborn
column2: high above the kings of the earth.

column1: 29 ^ I will keep my mercy for him for ever
column2: and my covenant faithful to him.

column1: 30 ^ And I will make his seed to endure for evermore
column2: and his throne as the days of heaven.

column1: 31 ^ If his children forsake my law
column2: and walk not in my judgments

column1: 32 ^ if they profane my justices
column2: and keep not my commandments

column1: 33 ^ I will visit their iniquities with a rod
column2: and their sins with stripes.

column1: 34 ^ But my mercy I will not take away from him
column2: nor will I do harm in my truth.

column1: 35 ^ Neither will I profane my covenant
column2: and the words that proceed from my mouth I will not make void.

column1: 36 ^ Once have I sworn by my holiness
column2: if I will lie unto David~;

column1: 37 ^ his seed shall endure for ever
column2: and his throne as the sun before me

column1: 38 ^ and as the moon perfect for ever
column2: and a faithful witness in heaven.

column1: 39 ^ But thou hast rejected and despised~; thou hast been angry with my anointed.
40 ^ Thou hast overthrown the covenant of thy servant~; thou hast profaned his sanctuary on the earth.
41 ^ Thou hast broken down all his hedges~; thou hast made his strength fear.
42 ^ All that pass by the way have robbed him~; he is become a reproach to his neighbours.
43 ^ Thou hast set up the right hand of them that oppress him~; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
44 ^ Thou hast turned away the help of his sword
column2: and hast not assisted him in battle.

column1: 45 ^ Thou hast made his purification to cease
column2: and thou hast cast his throne down to the ground.

column1: 46 ^ Thou hast shortened the days of his time~; thou hast covered him with confusion.
47 ^ How long
column2: O Lord
column3: turnest thou away unto the end~? Shall thy anger burn like fire~?

column1: 48 ^ Remember what my substance is~; for hast thou constituted all the children of men in vain~?
49 ^ Who is the man that shall live and not see death
column2: that shall deliver his soul from the hand of hell~?

column1: 50 ^ Where are thy ancient mercies
column2: O Lord
column3: according to what thou didst swear to David in thy truth~?

column1: 51 ^ Be mindful
column2: O Lord
column3: of the reproach of thy servants
column4: which I have held in my bosom

column1: 52 ^ Wherewith thy enemies have reproached
column2: O Lord
column3: wherewith they have reproached the change of thy anointed.

column1: 53 ^ Blessed be the Lord for evermore. So be it
column2: so be it.
